name: CreditDigital
description: Easy to use point of sale finance options for your customers

team.name: Daniel Lipinski
team.bioHtml: CEO & Founder- Strong commercial acumen, with a passion for achieving results in emerging markets.

jobs.title: Head Of Credit
jobs.description:
What's the opportunity?

We're looking for an experienced and very hands on Head of SME Credit Risk to create our entire risk function. You will be joining a very product focused team and will own credit risk throughout the company - from new lending criteria all the way to implementations and creating automated decision engines. If you’re passionate about risk and the process of building an exciting credit model from the ground up and working with great people, you’ll fit right in.

Who are we?

CreditDigital allows SME vendors to provide an instant finance option to their SME customers at online checkout or point-of-sale. Business customers can then design their own terms to fit their budget and cashflow. We are trying to solve a massive problem in the B2B World and we are very excited to be amongst the first ones tackling it.

What will you be doing?

As the first risk member in the company, you will have the opportunity to set up the standards in how we work. As a product focused team, we trust each individual to be autonomous and work towards are shared goals. We are fully committed in supporting one another in any way possible. 

You will be in charge of:

•	All SME underwriting- including decisioning, along with any decision science work needed to build and deploy decisioning models and logic.
•	Provisioning, write offs and management of our P&L credit loss line
•	Act as a champion that drive ideas from start to completion: from research insights, to workflows all the way to release.
•	Prototype ideas to quickly access viability, and design the fine grained details of interactions.
•	Iterate based on feedback from the whole team and customers.
•	Work closely with engineers as they build and ship ideas.
What skills and experience do I need?
We are looking for someone that has done this before. You will be our #1 which is very exciting and you will get to set the tone of our portfolio.
•	An extensive credit risk background within a SME environment (with over 10 years of work experience in risks).
•	You have a deep understanding of managing credit risk. You should understand all aspects of the credit lifecycle from decision science, underwriting and score cards through to portfolio management, including collections and provisioning. 
•	You should understand and have developed decision systems, have a great knowledge of credit reference agency products and data (including reporting back) and should have experience of setting and reporting against credit control frameworks including building and operating IFRS9 compliant provisioning models.
•	Knowledge of legislation and regulation relating to retail and SME activities.
•	You will develop and maintain the company’s credit risk strategy and related policy.
•	Deliver an effective credit review methodology, plan and capability covering all aspects of credit risk.
•	Monitor and manage exposures at clients, products and portfolio level.
•	Experience with performing fundamental credit risk analysis of SME lending.
•	Technical background, ideally with a degree in a quantitative discipline.
•	Strong understanding of data, and computational skills such as SQL, Python, VBA
•	Excellent communicator that can articulate the thought behind proposals.
•	Able to collaborate with the engineers and the wider company on strategy and delivery.

Where will I be working from?

Normally you will be working from our WeWork Offices in Wilson Street, Old Street offices (3 min walk from the station) but we are a remote friendly bunch so you can adjust your schedule as you see fit.

What would I be paid?

Our pay is within the top 10% of the industry, for the matched role and experience, based on London rates. 

Salary is not everything. Our benefits are all aimed at supporting a life well lived away from work. We don't offer free beers on tap (but we do anyway) but rather:

•	25 days off per annum plus bank holidays.
•	35 hours / week. Normal working hours are between 10am – 6pm.
•	Flexibility to adjust your daily hours.

jobs.title: Partnership Manager- OTE £60k
jobs.description:
CreditDigital – Partnership Manager


CreditDigital is looking for a partnerships manager to help grow key B2B relationships, and offer our new payments solution platform to their customers. You’ll lead the sales effort to accelerate and scale our business and as the face of CreditDigital on the ground, you’ll work hand-in-hand with our Founders to devise and execute the strategy for the UK.


We are an exciting and very well funded early stage Fintech startup. Our mission is to solve the problem of our vendors missing out on sales by allowing them to offer extended trade credit to their customers.


The role:
As Partnerships Manager you responsible for finding and helping our partners get the very best out of CreditDigital for their customers.


You will be responsible for operating across the full sales-cycle identifying, contacting, pitching and winning new partnerships. But most importantly identifying the needs of that channel and accurately matching CreditDigital with their clients needs.


Build a loan book – you will make decisions on your own set of customers and will be expected to grow your own loan book. You should thrive in a KPI driven environment where you are responsible for meeting targets.


You will ensure we do our best to meet our customer’s needs and offer a fast, slick service.



You will need:
• 5+ years of experience in B2B sales, preferably within the SME sector or alternative lending.
•	Strong business acumen and a working understanding of what makes a good business good, so you can quickly identify the key drivers.
•	The ability to interpret financial statements and an understanding of the key risk drivers specific to SMEs.
•	An analytical mindset with a practical approach to problem solving.
•	To be confident, focused and enthusiastic. You should be comfortable in a fast-paced startup environment where every month needs to be a record month.
•	Good communication skills. You will have direct telephone contact with Vendors and business customers to extract additional information so need a friendly telephone manner.
•	The ability to come up with innovative and scalable solutions to day-to-day problems and suggest changes to processes to improve our efficiency.


•	Commission, 25 days of paid holiday, plus UK public holidays. And we don’t expect you to work on your birthday so you can have an extra day off

jobs.title: Sales Executive @ Credit Digital
jobs.description:
Sales Executive

Credit Digital is a point-of-sale loan platform for retail businesses, allowing them to offer a variety of finance/ repayment options to their customers.

We partner with leading lenders to allow businesses to offer their customers the greatest choice and best rates for their product/ service purchase.

We are VC-funded and our entrepreneurial management team has previously exited a number of companies for £60m +.

This is a great opportunity to join the business at a time when you can really make the role your own and influence the direction of the business in a large untapped market.



The Role

We are looking for an experienced and entrepreneurial Sales people, who will form a pivotal part of the product strategy and roadmap for Credit Digital.

You will work closely with the CEO and Head Of Product day to day to help shape the future of our products: both App and Web.


Key responsibilities include:

- Helping to create and manage our sales pipeline
- Closing inbound and outbound leads via phone and email
- Managing and recording interactions in CRM system (HubSpot)
- Manage and train the sales team
- Thinking strategically about how to improve sales pitch and process



You will have experience:

- Proven experience and a track record of success in B2B sales, taking leads from discovery to close on the phone
- Confidence in selling an innovative SaaS product, providing both online demos
- Experience in B2B enterprise sales would be a great advantage, as would experience selling into similar target roles, sectors and international territories
- Working in a sales team in a start-up (ideally tech/SaaS based)
- 5+ years sales experience
- Working with a CRM system



Benefits:

- Uncapped Commission on sales- should as a minimum double your basic
- Opportunity for rapid career growth within fast growing company
- Pension
- Regular team lunches and trips
- Working with a fun, smart team

jobs.title: Senior Partnership Sales
jobs.description:
CreditDigital – Senior  Partnerships Sales Manager

CreditDigital are looking for a partnerships sales manager to help B2B vendors discover, learn about, and offer our new payments solution platform to their customers.

We are an exciting and very well-funded early stage fintech start-up. Our mission is to solve the broken world of business payments, allowing vendors to offer extended credit to their customers.

Partnerships are critical to CreditDigital’s vision - we want all businesses to be able to access finance where they want it, when they want it. In practise, this means access from within a range of the day-to-day services and tools they use to run their business, whether that’s their accounting software, payments platform or even their banking service.
As Partnerships Sales Manager, you will be responsible for developing our partnerships and direct sales strategy, working with the executive team to implement it. 
The partnerships team covers a range of partner channels, including larger strategic partnerships, affiliate websites and services, commercial finance brokers, accountants, and B2B vendors.
You will be required to develop high quality leads and insight, and then use your excellent communication and project management skills to guide the partnership through successful implementation of your strategy. The executive team have already built strong relationships with a number of key partners, and your role will focus on the strategy for both optimising these existing relationships and entering into targeted new partnerships. In essence the entire cycle.
REQUIREMENTS
Your specific responsibilities will include:

•	Winning new strategic partnerships 

•	Defining our growth strategy
•	Establishing fast and effective ways to get these partnerships active with minimal tech requirements- be lean
•	Liaising with the CEO, CTO and Head of Product to manage expectations and initiate the partnerships

We look for people that are smart, humble, motivated and who are always looking to improve. Ideally, you’ll have:

•	Have worked within in a start-up, corporate strategy or banking team (ideally 3-5 years), so you have a strong grounding in frameworks and tools for shaping and delivering strategy, and measuring its success

•	Hustle, you will be expected to make things happen fast! 
•	Have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills; able to process large amounts of data to drive business strategies and decisions
•	Have excellent communication and listening skills, including the ability to explain complex information clearly and simply, and the ability to articulate your thinking clearly and concisely in writing
•	Be a self-starter, who can work in an unstructured environment; you can deal with ambiguity and manage projects effectively with good attention to detail
•	Be confident manipulating data yourself in Excel/Google Sheets, or have experience with other data analytics software
•	Be great at stakeholder management; you’ll be working with a variety of people from across the business

BENEFITS
You will always have a say in the business and have the opportunity to really make a difference. We help all our employees become top performers and reward everyone.
Everyone at CreditDigital is smart, humble and motivated to do a good job, so you are bound to love working here. 
We all enjoy:
•	A lovely office in central London, right by Angel Tube Station

•	Stand up and down desks- believe us this is amazing

•	Free unlimited drinks every Thursday

•	Regular company night outs
•	Pool, FIFA tournaments and yoga
•	Half priced Cinema tickets
